content.description: From the last wave of route development on the Comb, OTR is a high quality knob climb with a memorable thin crack up high. Easily 4-star climbing, but docked a star for the scrappy start. The climbing is well protected by a mix of perfectly located 3/8" bolts and gear. Pitch 1 angles right, past the 10a crux, then up a knobby face. Pitch 2 starts with more steep knob grappling (5.9 reach) then eases off, passing a couple gear placements. Pitch 3 attains the left-trending flake crack above (10b), then finishes with more knobs. Rappel the route using double 60s.
content.protection: First pitch is all bolts, pitches two and three are mix of bolts and gear. Full route requires a standard rack, double on cams under 2", plus a dozen draws.
content.location: Approach using the strip of old growth, then follow the horizontal log as described under The Comb overview. Â From the end of the log, continue right another ~300' to the base of the route - see photos. Once you spot the bolts, reaching the start (3" fir tree) requires ascending a steep vegetated ramp angling left.

content.description: An early Comb route with great knob and slab climbing and stainless hardware. Can climb as a single pitch or as an alternative start to Over the Rainbow.
content.protection: Draws and a light rack, double ropes for descent.
content.location: Left side of the Fourth Tooth, about 50 right of Over the Rainbow. Starts at a 20' vertical wall (photo), where there is a fixed piton (seems solid?) in a diagonal crack. After the bouldery start, follow bolts (tan coated hangers) and gear up and slightly left to share the first belay of OTR.
